docs.lead_paragraph: Specialists told Congress that the way Medicare pays for the drug, used to treat dialysis patients, encourages overuse and raises the risk of heart complications.

docs.lead_paragraph: Health officials reported that antidepressant medications appeared to increase significantly the risk of suicide attempts and related behaviors in adults under 25.

headline.main: Study Finds Medication Raises Suicide Risks in Young Adults
headline.print_headline: Study Finds Medication Raises Suicide Risks in Young Adults

docs.snippet: Health officials reported that antidepressant medications appeared to increase significantly the risk of suicide attempts and related behaviors in adults under 25.

docs.lead_paragraph: In a long-awaited analysis, health officials reported yesterday that antidepressant medications appeared to increase significantly the risk of suicide attempts and related behaviors in adults under 25, while reducing such risks in older people. The analysis, the most comprehensive and rigorous to date, found that suicidal behavior of any kind was rare, and that people taking the medications were no more likely to kill themselves than those taking placebo pills. But adults under 25 taking the drugs were more than twice as likely as those on placebos to report a suicide attempt, or to prepare for one by, say, writing a suicide note.

headline.main: Study Finds Medication Raises Suicide Risks in Young Adults

docs.abstract: Food and Drug Administration releases long-awaited analysis showing that antidepressant medications appear to increase significantly risk of suicide in adults under 25, while reducing such risk in older people; finds those under 25 taking antidepressants are more than twice as likely to report suicide attempt or prepare for one; more than dozen drugs are included in study (M)
docs.snippet: In a long-awaited analysis, health officials reported yesterday that antidepressant medications appeared to increase significantly the risk of suicide attempts and related behaviors in adults under 25, while reducing such risks in older people.     ...

docs.lead_paragraph: Because of Pfizer’s failed trial, drugs similar to torcetrapib from other companies could face greater scrutiny — and delays — in getting to market.
